      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Skeletonizer(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPoints, double densifyFactor, boolean jiggle, int enhancedCircle, int enhancedIntersect, boolean useCLIP)
      this version does not remove holes!
      Skeletonizer(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPoints, double densifyFactor, boolean jiggle, int enhancedCircle, int enhancedIntersect, boolean useCLIP, int holeRemoval)
      holeRemoval = Skeletonizer.KEEPHOLES (normal operation) = Skeletonizer.REMOVEHOLES (compute without holes, if line overlaps hole, throw error) = Skeletonizer.SMARTHOLES (minimizes computation with holes.

      takes an input polygon and returns a new polygons without the holes (except for the holes in keeprings).
      SkelLineString[] skeletonize(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPointsPoints)
      main entry prepare data - remove unnecessary riverInOutPoints - add extra riverInOutPoints if there are only 0 or 1 - remove polygon points that are <0.1m from a river entry point - translate to origin (for precision) - remove acute angled portions of the polygon at riverInOutPoints + add the translated riverInOutpoints - densify so vertex-vertex distance less than 50m for all vertices on a ring - number vertices of the polygon - run adaptive densify + at this point we have a "good polygon" and river entry points.
      SkelLineString[] skeletonizeMain(Polygon wb, com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] riverInOutPoints)
      1.

      do the smart thing with holes return true if it worked, otherwise return false

      SkelLineString[] trimExitEntryPoint(Polygon poly, SkelLineString[] inputSkelLines, Coordinate[] riverPoints)
      change any of the "keepMe" (exit/entry point edges) so its clipped to the node.

      • Skeletonizer

        public Skeletonizer(Polygon wb,
                    com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPoints,
                    double densifyFactor,
                    boolean jiggle,
                    int enhancedCircle,
                    int enhancedIntersect,
                    boolean useCLIP,
                    int holeRemoval)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        holeRemoval = Skeletonizer.KEEPHOLES (normal operation) = Skeletonizer.REMOVEHOLES (compute without holes, if line overlaps hole, throw error) = Skeletonizer.SMARTHOLES (minimizes computation with holes. see Skeletonizer.removedHoles and Skeletonizer.keptHoles for what happened to the holes)
        Parameters:
        wb -
        riverInOutPoints -
        densifyFactor -
        jiggle -
        enhancedCircle -
        enhancedIntersect -
        useCLIP -
        holeRemoval -
        Throws:

      • findClosest

        public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point findClosest(SkelLineString line,
                                                     java.util.List ps)
        find the closest point in ps to the edge. must be less <0.1 units or will return null
        Parameters:
        line - line
        ps - list of com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate
        Returns:

      • trimExitEntryPoint

        public SkelLineString[] trimExitEntryPoint(Polygon poly,
                                           SkelLineString[] inputSkelLines,
                                           Coordinate[] riverPoints)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        change any of the "keepMe" (exit/entry point edges) so its clipped to the node. Also might add a wee little edge to connect the keepme edge to the actual vertex node. This happens sometimes when a river entry point is at the extream left of the polygon. The inserted line is <0.01m long.
        Parameters:
        inputSkelLines -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • trimByEndpoints

        public java.util.ArrayList trimByEndpoints(Polygon wb,
                                           java.util.ArrayList edges)
        take a list of voronoi segments + keep any that have keepMe set + throw away any that have one of the end points outside the polygon
        Parameters:
        wb - waterbody to clip to
        edges - voronoi segments
        Returns:
        list of SkeletonLineString

      • computeNetwork

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • produceSkeleton

        public SkelLineString[] produceSkeleton(Polygon wb,
                                        Voronoi voron)
        1. create the voronoi diagram w/initial clipping (say 80,000 edges) 2. clip any edges that have an end point outside the polygon (resulting in 40,000) 3. compute the network 4. throw away "dangling" ends of the network (resulting in 3,000) 5. clip any of these edges not within the polygon (might remove one or two) 6. recompute network 7. throw away "dangling" end of the network
        Parameters:
        voron - diagram with points inserted into it
        Returns:

      • skeletonizeMain

        public SkelLineString[] skeletonizeMain(Polygon wb,
                                        com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] riverInOutPoints)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        1. get polygon and input points 3. modify the oringal polygon so it has the riverInOutPoints removed and replaced with 2 points 4. insert the points into the voronoi diagram 5. process the diagram (other function)
        Parameters:
        wb - waterbody
        riverPoints - vertices of the polygon
        Returns:
        skeleton
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • skeletonize

        public SkelLineString[] skeletonize(Polygon wb,
                                    com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point[] riverInOutPointsPoints)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        main entry prepare data - remove unnecessary riverInOutPoints - add extra riverInOutPoints if there are only 0 or 1 - remove polygon points that are <0.1m from a river entry point - translate to origin (for precision) - remove acute angled portions of the polygon at riverInOutPoints + add the translated riverInOutpoints - densify so vertex-vertex distance less than 50m for all vertices on a ring - number vertices of the polygon - run adaptive densify + at this point we have a "good polygon" and river entry points. - run the skeletonizer - put in fantom edges (connecting the real in/out point to the re-located point for acute angles)
        Parameters:
        wb -
        riverInOutPoints -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • reformulate

        public Coordinate[] reformulate(Coordinate[] original,
                                java.util.ArrayList trans)
        takes the orginal river entry points and the result of the corner clipper makes a new list of coordinates that reflects the new location of the river entry points
        Parameters:
        original - original river entry points
        trans - SkelLineString produced by the sharp angle corner clipper
        Returns:

      • handleRiverPoints

        public Polygon handleRiverPoints(Polygon wb,
                                 Coordinate[] riverCoords,
                                 boolean insertPoints)
        number = 0 for each ring number += 10 for each point in ring if point is a river entry point then number += 11 Add river entry point A number++ Add river entry point B number +=10 For example, a ring with two entry point would go like this: 1st point labelled 10 2nd point labelled 10 ... (hit river entry point) new point labelled 21 new point labelled 22 next point labelled 33 .. (hit river entry point) new point labelled 44 new point labelled 45 next point labelled 56 .... Dont emit the ring's start and end point twice (they are equal) This is modified version of brent's code (thats why there are strange numbers)
        Parameters:
        wb - input polygon
        riverCoords - river entry points
        insertPoints - true if you want the river entry point replaced with 2 points
        Returns:
        list of list of skelCoordinates. This is a list of rings. remove the last point from each ring and its ready to go in voronoi diagram

      • makeRiverEntryPoints

        public Coordinate[] makeRiverEntryPoints(int location,
                                         Coordinate[] cs)
        replace a point with two points very near to it. use the edges that come into and go out of this edge be wise if location =0 (first points in ring --> use 2nd to last point in ring) dont call with location = cs.length-1 (last point --> call with location =0)
        Parameters:
        location - location in the coordinate array of the point you want to replace
        cs - ring coords
        Returns:
        array of 2 coordinates

      • makeUnique

        public Coordinate[] makeUnique(Coordinate[] in)
        This will sort then remove points that are equal
        Parameters:
        in - array of coordinate
        Returns:
